entry.title: Variable Pay Worksheets - Objectives appearing only for the one of the two Bonus Plans
entry.content:
Dears, 

We encounter this problem: In employee’s profile, there are two records in the Compensation Information. After importing employees from Employee Central and running the Bonus Calculation, we launched the Variable Pay worksheet. In the View Details section, the calculated amounts are correct. However, Objectives are only appearing for one of the two Bonus Plans — specifically, the Annual Bonus Plan linked to the most recent Compensation Information record.

Our configuration includes:

  • Bonus Calculation Equation:
    base x (business performance + team performance + individual performance)
  • Rating Configuration > Display Assignment As:
    Aggregated as one payout summary row 

     Many thanks in advance.

      any thoughts? 

     

    @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Issue in processing multiple PO in behavior class usi...
entry.content:
Hello @Renuga 

You are seeing this because EML functions within RAP's behaviour logic.:

  • When you modify another BO (here: I_PurchaseOrderTP_2) from a behaviour class, your EML must run IN LOCAL MODE so the changes are buffered in the same save sequence as your outer BO
  • If you fire several MODIFY ENTITIES calls without IN LOCAL MODE, only the last call is recorded in the interaction buffer; earlier ones do not make it to the final save.
  • Also ensure each generated child row has a unique %cid (per request)

Use this alternative (single shot, local mode, unique CIDs)

DATA lt_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE

  I_PurchaseOrderTP_2\purchaseorderitem\_PurOrdPricingElement.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO1'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO1_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '1'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

APPEND VALUE #( %key-purchaseorder     = 'PO2'

                %key-purchaseorderitem = '0010'

                %target = VALUE #( (

                  %cid                   = 'CID_PO2_0010'

                  conditiontype          = 'FVA1'

                  conditionrateamount    = '2'

                  conditioncurrency      = 'USD' ) ) ) TO lt_create.

 

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 **IN LOCAL MODE**

  ENTITY PurchaseOrderItem

    CREATE BY \_PurOrdPricingElement

      SET FIELDS WITH lt_create

  MAPPED   DATA(mapped)

  FAILED   DATA(failed)

  REPORTED DATA(reported).

 

" Optional: check failures

IF line_exists( failed-purchaseorderitem[  ] ).

  " handle/log messages from 'reported'

ENDIF.

 

If you prefer separate calls

You can still issue the MODIFY ENTITIES command twice, but make sure to add IN LOCAL MODE to each call and use different %cids.

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_PurchaseOrderTP_2 IN LOCAL MODE ...

Extra checks

  • Ensure the PO items exist and aren’t locked by another LUW.
  • Avoid using COMMIT WORK within behaviour classes—the framework commits after SAVE is triggered.
  • Inspect FAILED/REPORTED after the first call; if it’s not in local mode, you’ll usually see no hard error, just the earlier changes being overwritten by the next interaction.

Below are some helpful SAP Documentation

  1. SAP Help – Entity Manipulation Language (EML): explains IN LOCAL MODE and how it affects buffering and checks in the save sequence. SAP Help Portal-Entity Manipulation Language (EML)
  2. ABAP Keyword Doc – MODIFY ENTITY/ENTITIES: full syntax and usage for RAP MODIFY with CREATE BY/associations. SAP Help Portal-MODIFY ENTITY, ENTITIES-ABAP Keyword Documentation

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: ‌🇨🇳‌ 2025 CSUA Annual Conference
entry.content:
The China SAP User Association (CSUA) invites SAP professionals, enterprise leaders, and technology experts to its 2025 Annual Membership Conference and 13th Anniversary Celebration!

This year’s theme, Suite-Driven Business, AI-Empowered Future, reflects the evolving intersection of enterprise digitalization and artificial intelligence.

The morning agenda features a series of focused sessions covering both business and technical topics. Key areas include:

  • SAP Business Suite and Business AI
  • Generative large model applications
  • Data asset management and analytical reporting, et al. 

The afternoon will spotlight the prestigious 2025 CSUA Golden Dragon Awards. Award-winning enterprises will present their Golden Dragon Annual Aotian projects, showcasing leadership in digital transformation.

Additionally, CSUA will officially release a series of group standards developed in collaboration with member enterprises.

This conference is targeted at members of CSUA and SAP user organizations (limited seats).

Check out the agenda and register here. 

If you want to learn about the localization topics in China provided by SAP experts, join the Greater China - Human Capital Management Localization WorkZone group.

entry.title: Re: SAP Personas speed optimization
entry.content:
Tamas, Krists, I am still struggling with this snapshot mode. I simply can not get it to work. Could you please check my code, when I am gathering data from equipment different tabs, how should I enter snapshot to speed the read? Where to put start stop, how to take snapshot?

// 1. Read all serial numbers from the multiline input field var serijske = session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/textEditPersonas_175394649736346").text.split("\n"); // Final result array var output = []; // 2. Loop through all serial numbers for (var i = 0; i < serijske.length; i++) { var serijska = serijske[i].trim(); if (serijska === "") continue; // skip empty lines // Enter IH08 transaction session.callTransaction("IH08"); session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/txtSERNR-LOW").text = serijska; session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/ctxtEQTYP-LOW").text = "J"; session.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[1]/btn[8]").press(); // If no data is found, log only serial number with NOT_FOUND if (!session.idExists("wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\01/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0102/subSUB_0102B:SAPLITO0:1060/ctxtITOB-SUBMT")) { output.push(serijska + "\tNOT_FOUND"); session.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/btn[3]").press(); // back session.utils.changeFlavor("00155D0207661FE08ACBD6B0C3DA437C"); continue; } // Read basic data from tab T01 var material = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\01/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0102/subSUB_0102B:SAPLITO0:1060/ctxtITOB-SUBMT').text; var opis = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\01/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0102/subSUB_0102B:SAPLITO0:1060/txtMINST-MAKTX').text; var crtnaeq = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\01/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0102/subSUB_0102B:SAPLITO0:1060/subSUB_1060A:SAPLITO0:1065/txtITOB-TIDNR').text; var obrat = "", strankaeq = ""; // Check if data is in tab T07 session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\07').select(); if (session.idExists("wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\07/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0122/subSUB_0122C:SAPLITO0:1220/txtEQBS-LBBSA")) { // Read from tab T07 obrat = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\07/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0122/subSUB_0122C:SAPLITO0:1220/ctxtEQBS-B_WERK').text; strankaeq = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\07/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0122/subSUB_0122C:SAPLITO0:1220/ctxtEQBS-KUNNR').text; } else { // Otherwise, read from tab T06 session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\06").select(); obrat = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\06/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0122/subSUB_0122C:SAPLITO0:1220/ctxtEQBS-B_WERK').text; strankaeq = session.findById('wnd[0]/usr/tabsTABSTRIP/tabpT\\06/ssubSUB_DATA:SAPLITO0:0122/subSUB_0122C:SAPLITO0:1220/ctxtEQBS-KUNNR').text; } // Save data in output array, separated by TAB output.push([serijska, material, opis, crtnaeq, obrat, strankaeq].join("\t")); // Exit IH08 and return to previous flavor session.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/btn[3]").press(); session.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/btn[3]").press(); session.utils.changeFlavor("00155D0207661FE08ACBD6B0C3DA437C"); } // 3. Write all collected results into the target multiline text field session.findById("wnd[0]/usr/textEditPersonas_175672128663647").text = output.join("\n");

entry.title: Manually Adding Employees to Compensation (Duplicates)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

Are you aware of a way to control employee membership when manually adding employees to a compensation worksheet? What we’re trying to achieve is a standard validation that checks whether an employee is already part of the cycle and prevents the Admin from adding them again manually.

Currently, the system is generating worksheets with all eligible employees as expected. However, the Admin is still able to manually add employees afterward, and the system is allowing duplicates to be added. It would be really helpful if the system could display a warning—similar to the one shown when an employee is not eligible for the cycle.

Note: The “Do not duplicate employees” setting is enabled, but as per SAP KBA 2084284, this does not apply to employees added manually by the Admin.

Do you have any insights or workarounds for this?

entry.title: Re: Not able to post data to OData V4 API in S4
entry.content:
Hi,

XML input used:

<Details> <DetailsType> <UUID>85a76f00-1920-4a6d-b67c-64a9f87248a0</UUID> <bname>HARTDT</bname> <auth_type>IN</auth_type> <gpid>RK89IO04</gpid> <waers>EUR</waers> <usdlimit>65000</usdlimit> <limit>1300.00</limit> <approver>BERGGJ</approver> <temp_delegation>X</temp_delegation> <_Limit> <bukrs>1000</bukrs> <usdlimit>400.00</usdlimit> <limit>400.00</limit> <UUID>85a76f00-1920-4a6d-b67c-64a9f87248a0</UUID> </_Limit> </DetailsType> </Details>

Error Details: com.sap.gw.core.ip.exception.ODataProcessingException: The XML is malformed

We are using Query Builder to generate the XSD for the POST request and using that as a reference to build the payload.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
<xs:element name="Details">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="DetailsType">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element type="xs:string" nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="UUID" xmlns=""/>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="bname">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="40"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="auth_type">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="2"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="gpid">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="40"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="waers">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="5"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="usdlimit">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="13"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="limit">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="20"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="approver">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="40"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="temp_delegation">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="1"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="true" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" name="_Limit">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="LimitType">
<xs:complexType>
<xs:sequence>
<xs:element type="xs:string" nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="UUID" xmlns=""/>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="bukrs">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="4"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="usdlimit">
<xs:simpleType>
<xs:restriction base="xs:string" xmlns="">
<xs:maxLength value="13"/>
</xs:restriction>
</xs:simpleType>
</xs:element>
<xs:element nillable="false" maxOccurs="1" name="limit">
<xs:simpleType>

<xs:simpleType>

</xs:schema>

entry.title: SAP APO deleting an order in the planning board, makes other process orders disappear
entry.content:
Issue happens in scheduling board in 000 version: if the user deletes an order in the schedule of sequenced process/planned orders, and doesn"t save.

After deletion, the user drags/pushes the first remaining "sequence" of orders to the expected start date a bit further in future.

When doing this, the whole train of orders vanishes.

This problem does not occur in SIM. So it probably has to do with the connection to S4

After saving or refreshing, the orders re-appear

/SAPAPO/CDPS0 - Detailed Scheduling Planning Board - Variable View

entry.title: Re: Standard Menu using Oops ALV
entry.content:
thank you @RaymondGiuseppi , I struck with this issue for a long time and no AI tools helped me. but this solution works for me with below method call in PAI module.

call method <ref-to-grid>->set_function_code
  changing
    c_ucomm = l_okcode.

entry.title: SAP Cloud Integration - Best approach to connect SAP PO 7.5 to CPI HTTPS endpoint with CSRF enabled
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a requirement to connect from SAP PO 7.5 (using the REST adapter) to a CPI HTTPS endpoint where CSRF protection is enabled.
Our goal is to achieve this integration with minimal changes to the existing SAP PO iFlow.

  • What is the recommended approach to handle the CSRF token in this scenario?

  • Is it necessary to implement an Async-Sync Bridge on the PO side, or are there more efficient alternatives to manage the token exchange?

Any guidance, best practices, or references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,

Niranjan Nayak

entry.title: Standard outbound idoc don't send specific fields
entry.content:
Hi all,

I'm working with a standard outbound IDoc in SAP and I'd like to exclude or blank out some specific fields from being sent. Is there a standard tcode or configuration setting that allows me to disable or hide these fields without coding or using user exits?

I need this without changing the idoc type (no custom idoc as a result).

Thanks.

entry.title: Crystal Report 2008 freezes on loading Formula Workshop

I have tried to re-install it but it still keeps freezing whenever I try to open formula workshop.

I feel like it opens a window backend but I cannot see it anywhere. It dings when I tried to click on anywhere within Crystal Report window.

entry.title: Disable VizFrame default popover on data selection
entry.content:
I recently faced an issue while working with a VizFrame chart in SAPUI5.
My requirement was to disable/remove the default popover that appears when clicking on a data point in the chart.

Viz:VizFrame uiConfig="{applicationSet:'fiori'}"  id="VizChart"  vizType="column" 

After adding this Property, the default popover was removed automatically.

so question is Why Popover is Removed ?
Because in Fiori mode, SAP expects you to use your own popover or SmartPopover instead of the Viz standard one. That’s why the standard tooltip/popover is gone when you add this.

entry.title: Re: Building a Custom Digital Manufacturing POD Plugin — The New Easy Way
entry.content:
Hi Kevin,

Greetings!

I followed the steps and extracted the ZIP file locally. Then, I uploaded it in the Extensions tab of the POD Designer. However, it threw an error stating: "Designer/Component.json file is missing." To resolve this, I extracted all the files again, re-compressed them, and tried uploading once more.

Regards,
Vignesh

entry.title: Re: Email de notificação de entrega
entry.content:
Hello @ayglonfernando 

Good day

I understand what you require: in addition to the read receipt, you also want an email delivery confirmation (DSN – Delivery Status Notification) when a purchase order is sent via CL_BCS.

Here’s the gist and how to troubleshoot it:

1) A read receipt is not the same as delivery confirmation.

  • The read receipt relies on the recipient’s mail client, which they can ignore.
  • Delivery confirmation (DSN) relies on the SMTP infrastructure along the route. ABAP can request DSN, but only the mail servers can generate and return a “delivered OK” (many providers send failure DSNs but not success DSNs).

2) In ABAP (CL_BCS)

Make sure you explicitly request delivery status before send( 😞

DATA(lo_send) = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).

lo_send->set_document( lo_doc ).

lo_send->add_recipient( lo_rec ).

 

" Request DSN / status mails (use constants available in your release)

lo_send->set_status_attributes(

  i_requested_status = 'ALL'    " SUCCESS/FAILURE/DELAY as policy allows

  i_status_mail      = 'ALWAYS' ).

 

lo_send->send( ).

 

Exact constants may vary by release; the key is: request DSN explicitly.

3) On the mail server side (usually the real blocker)

Ask your email/admin team to verify:

  • The SMTP relay employed by S/4 advertises the DSN extension, as indicated by EHLO showing DSN.
  • It is set up to send successful DSNs, not just NDRS or failures. Many relays, such as some Exchange/Office 365 configurations, don’t send successful DSNs by policy.
  • Your SAP sender/domain is permitted to receive those DSN reports (not filtered by anti-spam)..
  • On-prem/PCE only: in SCOT, the SMTP node has DSN/status options enabled, and the send/status jobs are scheduled.

In Public Cloud (SaaS), you don’t have SCOT access, so DSN behaviour is entirely up to your external mail provider.

4) Why does it work in ECC but not now

Most often, the SMTP path changes during the move (to a new relay/gateway that doesn’t issue successful DSNs). ABAP still requests DSN, but the server simply doesn’t send the “delivered” notification.

5) Practical paths forward

  • Confirm your code requests DSN (step 2) and your mail relay supports/permits successful DSNs (step 3).
  • If your provider won’t send successful DSNs, use operational alternatives:
    • rely on the outbound status/monitor (message transferred) and
    • treat bounces/NDRs as failures, or
    • Use your mail gateway’s delivery tracking report.

With kind regards

Chuma

GenAI Assit content (Useful references)DSN (SMTP extension): RFC 3461 – SMTP Service Extension for Delivery Status Notifications. IETF DatatrackerRFC Editor

Read receipts (MDN): RFC 8098 – Message Disposition Notification (successor to RFC 3798). IETF Datatracker

 CL_BCS method: SET_STATUS_ATTRIBUTES documentation (requesting status/DSN). SAP Help Portal

Exchange/Office 365 DSNs: Microsoft docs (NDRs are the common DSN type). Microsoft Learn

Public Cloud output email (no SCOT; use Output Management/external mail): SAP S/4HANA Cloud Output Management overview. SAP Community

entry.title: Re: How to remove popover in stacked column vizFrame libr...
entry.content:
I recently faced an issue while working with a VizFrame chart in SAPUI5.
My requirement was to disable/remove the default popover that appears when clicking on a data point in the chart.

Viz:VizFrame uiConfig="{applicationSet:'fiori'}"  id="VizChart"  vizType="column" 

After adding this Property, the default popover was removed automatically.

so question is Why Popover is Removed ?
Because in Fiori mode, SAP expects you to use your own popover or SmartPopover instead of the Viz standard one. That’s why the standard tooltip/popover is gone when you add this.

entry.title: Re: Discrepancy in Amount Calculation D
entry.content: One straight forward approach is to have one manual header condition in your pricing procedure which should be placed after the tax condition type.  This lets you correct the final invoice total without altering item-level tax logic. Also, check whether the "Group Condition" is ticked for that tax condition type which should also reduce rounding discrepancies across items.

  2. This data should then be written directly into a dimension of the underlying model.
  3. I also need the ability to retrieve data from the dimension back into the Story.

My main requirement is to implement this using JavaScript in a Story, and not via Data Actions.

  • Is this possible within SAC Stories?
  • If yes, how can it be achieved with scripting?
  • If not, what would be the closest workaround?

entry.title: Re: On/Offboarding - Task are marked as Optional but mand...
entry.content:
Hello syeapAB,

Please refer also to KBA 3472582 - [Onboarding] Responsible Group has to be added for both Custom and Standard Task:
It is required to add the responsible group for both Standard and Custom task whether the task is optional or required

Also implementation guide Enhancements to Custom Tasks for Onboarding and Offboarding:
You're now required to assign a role or group to a custom task before you can save it.

There is no workaround as far as I know.

Kind Regards,
Noemi

entry.title: Plant Maintenance Integration with FICO,MM,PP, QM,HCM,EHS and other modules
entry.content:
Plant maintenance integrates with many of the modules and below are the some of the modules that plant maintenance integrates with: 

FICO(Finance and controlling) :- 

Below are the integration points of plant maintenance with FICO.
Company Code: - A plant will always be assigned to the company code. 
Cost center: - Cost Center is an organizational unit within a controlling area that is used to collect and record costs incurred from business activities.
Investment order: -  investment order needs cost budgeting for an order will be done.
Allocation Structure: -  In the allocation structure the cost elements will be taken from the CO in which these cost elements will gets reflected is any maintenance order have consumption of materials, Labour cost, 3rd party material procurement etc... which will flow the costs to the FI. 
Asset master creation: - When an equipment is being created then the asset will be created with a configuration.
Settlement Of an Order: - The settlement of an order is actually being done for an order because at the cost needs to be settled.
Settlement Profile: - The settlement profile will be assigned to the order type.
Activity Type: - In activity type the price or the cost for labour per hour will be determined by FICO consultant and we need to maintain the activity type in the work center.

PP(Production Planning) :- 
Work Center: - In work center the capacity will be determined by the production planning team. Here the capacity refers to the availability of people and resources for maintenance work.
Equipment Master Data: - In equipment master data there is a field work center in the Location in which we need to give the production planning work center and whereas in the organization. 
Spare Part Preparation: - For example the spare part cannot be procured externally then the spare part will be produced by the production order and the settlement rule of order will be done to the maintenance order.
Refurbishment of Material:- Refurbishment of material will be done if any material in production needs to be repaired as soon as possible then we will just refurbish the material and replace the material within the machine as it was there before the breakdown.

MM(Material Management):-
Components:- The components that are required for maintenance of machine will be taken from the inventory.
Service Entry Sheet:- To procure the service from external that is the maintenance has to be done for a machine and there is no team that is present in the plant(internal team) then we will just raise purchase requestion from the maintenance order and after it the material management people will procure the service through ML81N."
Split valuation:- Split valuation for a material has to be configured so that we can perform the refurbishment order.
Details of plant:- The details of plant related namely Purchase Organization, Vendor, Supplier, Outline agreement number etc..
Serial Number Profile:- A serial number profile must be configured for the material to enable the creation of equipment for that material.
Goods Issue:- Goods issue needs to be done for the order otherwise the technician cannot perform the maintenance activities that are present in the order.
Goods Receipt:- Goods receipt has to be done for the Internal Refurbishment Order and the settlement will be done for the material.
Material Reservation:- after creating the maintenance order the materials will be reserved in the inventory automatically.
Procurement:- Procuring of non-stock material, service entry sheet through purchase requestion.

Quality Management:- 
CatLog Profile:- Catlog profile will be configured by the quality management team and it will be assigned for the equipment , functional location.
Calibration Order:- In calibration order inspection will be done and thereby the equipment can be used or not will be determined by the quality management team.

SD(Sales And Distribution):- 
The place where the sales and distribution as well as plant maintenance will gets integrated is in customer service module.

EHS(Environment Health & Safety):-
The integration part of PM with EHS comes only at the product safety, Work permit - while performing any maintenance at the dangerous or hazardous material or equipment's.

FREM(Flexible Real Estate Management):- 
Flexible real estate management and plant maintenance both comes under Enterprise Asset Management in SAP S/4 Hana.
Real Estate Object: - Real estate object will be considered as functional location/equipment.
Work order:- Notification and work order management à maintenance requests originating from RE-FX can be turned into PM notifications/ orders but this will be done with the help of CRM.
Service Provider Coordination: - PM order can trigger external services with the help of MM (material management) to work on RE-FX managed asset.

HCM(Human Capital Management):-
Person Responsible:- Here the person can be assigned to the work order , work center, Technical Object, Operations in work order too.

DMS(Document Management System):-
Documents can be uploaded for the technical objects, notifications , work orders etc... for information or to follow the rules to keep the equipment runs smoothly.

The above are some of the modules for which the plant maintenance will integrate with.

Hope its informative and feel free to comment for any improvements or suggestions.

Regards,
Neeraj.

entry.title: C_TS4FI_2023 Practice Questions
entry.content:
I recently passed the C_TS4FI_2023 (SAP S/4HANA Finance) exam 🎉 and I’d highly recommend a mix of official SAP study materials along with trusted practice resources.

The official SAP Learning Hub and SAP training guides are great for building a solid foundation, but what really helped me was Passexamhub. Their updated and exam-style practice questions matched the real test format closely and gave me the confidence I needed to clear the exam on my first attempt.

If you’re preparing, I’d suggest using both the official SAP resources for concepts and Passexamhub practice questions for realistic exam prep it’s the perfect combination.

entry.title: How to launch automatically a dynamic hyperlink of a report with its cuid in SAP BO
entry.content:
Hi , 

We have a dimension ( name ->Object )  in sap BO 4.2 which contains names of several reports and we would like to launch them automatically  in a new window visualizing the content of the report directly  without customizing every link manually using OpenDocument but  identifying every report using its cuid. 

We think that only we can do that base on the universe level but even doing that base on universe level we have to do it manually  (Hyperlink with OpenDocument ). Can't we ?

Please let me know your solution to do it automatically 

Thanks in advance

To define an object as a dynamic hyperlink  (UDT)

  1. Right-click on the object and select Object Properties.
    The Edit Object Properties dialog displays.
  2. Type the select statement and include the appropriate hyperlink.
  3. Save the new properties.
  4. Right-click on the object and select Object Format.
    The Object Format pane displays.
  5. Select the option Read As Hyperlink.
  6. Click OK to save the format settings.
  7. Use your reporting tool to create the report and test the link

entry.title: Re: OFB - Trigger Email Notification to respective Respon...
entry.content:
Hello syeapAB,

I would advise to customize the default email template:

Trigger: (ONB) Documents signed by New Hire Trigger
Category: (ONB) Document Flow Message Category

  1. Email Services  >  Active Templates  >  Manage Template (in top right corner)  >  +  > Reuse Template 
  2. Filter for the details above, active the template
  3. Then find the template and customize it
  4. You can create a copy of this template and configure it as per your needs


Kind Regards,
Noemi

entry.title: Re: Issue with Guest User Provisioning to SAP IAS
entry.content:
Hi Ari

There's no scpecific atribute for such "guests" users or I should say "the users that not exist in IAS".

Your specific issue seems to be with the Subject name Identifier or NameID atribute. I guess your BTP applicaitions are using email from the "identity store". this works only if you have your users created in IAS. If you don't want all your users in IAS you can work with Identity Federation Enabled and then you can pick to use a Entra attribute instead of all atributes from IAS. You can even keep both, using Entra as a fallback.

This scenario not having the Guests created in IAS might work for your scenario, but in general SAP is going to an approach were you'll need the users created anyway. This might not be needed now or maybe not mandatory for your scenario but seems that long term is SAP approach since more and more aplications requiere IAS user existance.

If you want to create your Guests in IAS I'd suggest to use a IPS provisioning job, you can filter your Guest Users from Entra based on some attribute and provision them to IAS using specific atributes based on IPS transformation. This uses standard SCIM protocol, so as long as you find the proper Graph API filter it should be straightforward.

Once you have your internal plus Guests users in IAS you can work with IAS atributes as you have in the sceenshot.

As I said this might not be mandatory at this point for your scenario and you might also be able to work with Identity Federation and pass Entra Attributes to the BTP application of needed.

Hello, 

We have integration flow for Business Partner replication from Sales V2 to SAP S4HANA Public Cloud. After replication S4 responses with following errors that 4 Partner Functions are missing:

-Mandatory partner function SP is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function BP is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function PY is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

-Mandatory partner function SH is missing for sales area 1000 10 10

We can't fill these Partner Functions because Sales V2 does not send it in the payload as result of change event. So we are not able to fill these nodes with Partner Functions, so we get errors above.

 

We tried to fill it with "constant values" at CPI so S4 receives these predefined payload (SP role code and this party ID exists in the target system, see attch).

But in that case S4 replies with following error (see attch.)

Maybe someone can help me with this issue?

entry.title: Re: Welcome to the new Paris community space !
entry.content:
Bonjour @pboulicaut,

SAP n’organise pas ces communautés locales : elles existent uniquement grâce à l’énergie, la volonté et le commitment personnel de membres de la communauté.
J’ai eu la même surprise que toi en découvrant ce “vide” il y a 4 ans, c’est sans doute parce que peu de personnes veulent porter cet initiative. C’est la raison pour laquelle je me suis lancé à Paris, puis à Lisbonne et à l’île Maurice (que j'explique ici).

Donc si tu veux voir naître une communauté dans d’autres grandes villes, il ne faut pas attendre SAP : c’est à toi d’apporter cette énergie et de te lancer, comme je l’ai fait. Tu ne seras pas seul : les organisateurs existants (dont moi) et l’équipe SAP Community pourront t’accompagner.

entry.title: Re: What’s Next for SAP Access Control 12.0?
entry.content:
Hi Vincent,

I know who you are and and I assure you it's not. We've a new note and improvement every day or so, because it doesn't work. IAG is great, but not if you also use it for ABAP - not to mention how often the product is down (reachable, but doesn't work) due to random changes. 

Don't get me wrong, I want it to work - I provide a lot of feedback to get it to a good mature product but it doesn't have that edge yet. I've lists and lists of constructive feedback that is freely available if you want to get it to the right people (even though our accountmanager, contract manager and your product manager and so on are also working on this).

entry.title: Troubleshoot CAP plugin for Advanced Event Mesh
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm currently trying out the CAP plugin for advanced event mesh.

I followed this documentation and tried to tune the bookshop sample to connect to AEM by adding this section in the package.json:

   "requires": {
      "messaging": {
        "kind": "advanced-event-mesh",
        "skipManagement": false,
        "credentials": {
          "user-provided": {
            "name": "advanced-event-mesh"
          }
        },
        "queue": {
          "queueName": "testQ",
          "permission": "EXLUSIVE",
          "ingressEnabled": true,
          "egressEnabled": true
        }
      }
    }

I was first encountering this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.


❗️ ERROR on server start: ❗️

 Error: Missing or malformed credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh.

Bind your app to a user-provided service with name "advanced-event-mesh" and credentials in the following format:
{
  "authentication-service": {
    "tokenendpoint": "https://<ias host>/oauth2/token",
    "clientid": "<client id>",
    "clientsecret": "<client secret>"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "advanced-event-mesh": {
      "uri": "https://<broker host>:<port>",
      "smf_uri": "wss://<broker host>:<port>"
    }
  },
  "vpn": "<vpn>"
}
    at _validateAndFetchEndpoints (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:37:91)

So I wired my AEM credentials via user-provided service.
Then followed this error message:

/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

Error: Missing credentials for SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh with plan "aem-validation-service".

You need to create a service binding.
    at _validateBroker (/Users/me/git/cloud-cap-samples/node_modules/@cap-js/advanced-event-mesh/cds-plugin.js:99:11)

So next I created an instance of the aem-validation-service  (in the same subaccount, as learned from this question) and bound it to CAP using cds bind. 

Finally, the cds watch (or cds serve command) starts up with no more errors. But now, somehow it is stuck after this step:

resolving cloud service bindings...
bound messaging to cf user provided service advanced-event-mesh
bound custom-service:cap2aem to cf managed service cap2aem:cap2aem-key
[cds] - loaded model from 7 file(s):

  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/srv/outbox.cds
  srv/user-service.cds
  srv/cat-service.cds
  srv/access-control.cds
  srv/admin-service.cds
  db/schema.cds
  ../node_modules/@sap/cds/common.cds

[cds] - connect to db > sqlite { url: ':memory:' }
  > init from db/init.js 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Genres.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.texts.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Books.csv 
  > init from db/data/sap.capire.bookshop-Authors.csv 
/> successfully deployed to in-memory database.

The app is not served at localhost:4004, nothing is happening after the log output "successfully deployed to in-memory database".
As I'm not super experienced with CAP, I don't know if I missed something crucial or how the issue could be examined further.

I'm very thankful for every hint or help provided.

entry.title: Re: Error while creating ILM store

Hello All,

I have checked the language version of the package, the consumption view i am extending and the extension view all have the same abap language version (standard abap in this case ).

Still i am unable to activate the view, can you please help me find what went wrong?

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewAppendName: true

@EndUserText.label: 'Extension for Monitor purchase order items'

 

extend view C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni with z_c_XXX

 

association [1..1] to I_PurchaseOrderItemAPI01 as _Purchaseorderitem

on C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni.PurchaseOrder = _Purchaseorderitem.PurchaseOrder

and C_PurchaseOrderItemMoni.PurchaseOrderItem = _Purchaseorderitem.PurchaseOrderItem

 

{

_Purchaseorderitem.IncotermsLocation1,

_Purchaseorderitem.IncotermsLocation2

 

}

entry.title: Give your Joule Agents 🤖 the gift of Memory 💭, with Hana Cloud ✨
entry.content:
When Joule agents can write/read memories in SAP HANA Cloud, they:

  • Remember business facts at scale (supplier habits, contract quirks, SLA exceptions) ✅

  • Retrieve them fast & accurately with HANA Cloud Vector Engine ⚡

  • Keep memories human-readable, sortable, and dead-simple to implement 🧩

That means fewer repeated mistakes, smarter suggestions, and agents that actually learn with your business over time.

An example of some memories for an invoice exception agent.
You can make them as detailed or a simple as you want in the agent prompt!

 

 

How it works

  1. A simple “Memories” table

    Human-readable text + metadata (who/what it’s about, when learned, importance, TTL, etc.).

    Optional: a vector column for semantic search.

  2. Vector search for recall

    Store an embedding of each memory → use approximate nearest neighbor (ANN) to fetch the right facts instantly (“Which supplier often uses expired POs?”). BM25 or other strategies are available. I love BM25's reliability for same-language and same-topic knowledge meshes.

  3. One tool your agent calls

    Add a tool (below) so your agent can append or update memories whenever it learns something new.

  4. Update the Agent prompt to have it use the memory well!

           Something like:

Before answering, search (memory.search_hana) with a concise query (supplier/invoice/PO terms; limit top_k≤8); 
use the results to tailor your response. 
Only write when you learn a new, stable, factual business detail; 
upsert (memory.upsert_hana) instead of inserting duplicates—treat as duplicate if normalized context matches or vector similarity ≥0.86 and the same entity (supplier/invoice/PO) is involved; 
if duplicate, refresh last_seen_at (and occurrence_count if available). Format memories as one dense sentence in context 
(e.g., YYYY-MM-DD | INV-XXXX | Supplier ABC | PO 4500001123 | 4,980.00 EUR | expired PO used) 
and a brief actionable description; keep context ≤220 chars, use present tense. 
Set importance 1–5 (5 = critical risk) and ttl_days (low importance decays, 0 = never expires). 
Do not store ephemeral chatter or sensitive data; prefer patterns over one-offs. 
If you update or add a memory, mention it briefly to the user; otherwise be concise and never dump full tables unless asked.

 

Add two memory tools (Joule Skills)

"Add Memory" is a simple SQL Write

"Retrieve Memory" is a simple SQL Read, with semantic search (BM25+Embeddings)

 

 

Advanced memory patterns (that HANA makes easy) 🚀

  • Disappearing memories (decay/TTL): small quirks fade unless they’re re-observed.

  • Hierarchical memories: supplier-site → supplier → region → global policy.

  • World representations: keep a simple graph of relationships (supplier↔plant, approver↔cost center), or materialize views for fast joins.

  • Learning from mistakes: tag memories with resolution outcome so the agent prefers strategies that worked.

 

Result:

A living, human-readable knowledge fabric your Joule agents can trust.
It's fast, explainable, and always improving. ✨

entry.title: Re: Showing Onboarding Documents in Employee Central Profile

Hello @anthiap1 ,

entry.title: SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 Beta Program – Call for participation
entry.content:
Hello Community,

it has been a while since we delivered SAP GUI for Windows 8.00 in Q1/2023 and now it is about time for a successor to release 8.00.
As mentioned in SAP Note 147519 we are planning to ship the next SAP GUI for Windows release, which will be called SAP GUI for Windows 8.10, in Q1/2026. This time, we do not have a revolutionary change like the true 64bit version we supplied with release 8.00, but we rather concentrated on theming, usability and features which help you use and operate SAP GUI for Windows. However, you will find some very interesting and relevant features in the list below that you might want to try before we deliver them to all customers.

New features in SAP GUI for Windows 8.10

We are just listing the most important features below, the full list of features will be provided during the introduction to the beta program should you participate.

Horizon Themes

The latest addition to the themes available in SAP GUI for Windows is the successor to the Quartz theme family. The Horizon themes offer a visual integration into the current Fiori 3.0 themes available in other SAP UI frameworks and introduce a state-of-the-art visual appearance (image showing Horizon and Horizon Dark themes):

Improvements in this area which differentiate the Horizon themes from previous theme families include:

  • A much stronger focus visualization
  • A better differentiation between read-only and editable elements (also in table structures)
  • When dialog boxes are displayed, the main window is displayed differently indicating that it is not active and drawing the visual focus to the dialog box
  • Completely reworked and more structured display of tabstrips
  • About 30-40 icons used by applications running in SAP GUI for Windows have regained more distinct colors
Custom Theming

With this feature, SAP GUI for Windows can be displayed in themes created by an administrator / user interface designer / user based on the official Horizon themes provided by SAP.
Use cases for using self-developed themes include:

  • Providing corporate identity (colors, branding image)
  • Improving certain aspects of the UI, because you have special visual requirements (like color blindness)
  • Distinguishing one SAP system from other SAP systems by the look of SAP GUI connected to those systems
  • Improving individual aspects of the official SAP theme that you might not like

A custom theme running in SAP GUI for Windows may for example look like this:


The theming capabilities offered with this feature supersede by far any kind of visual customization offered for SAP GUI for Windows until now. Additionally, you can basically re-use your existing themes created via SAP UI Theme Designer for SAP GUI for Windows. 

Caching for Configuration Files

In previous versions of SAP GUI for Windows only the SAP UI Landscape files could be cached on the local PC to avoid disruptions when the connection to a central configuration file could not be established. Now, caching is available for all relevant types of configuration files:

  • SAP UI Landscape files
  • SAP Security rules file
  • Theming configuration and content
  • Browser fallback configuration files

Caching has been completely reworked and harmonized.

Improvements for HTML Control based on WebView2 (Edge)

Several enhancements have been implemented for the WebView2 based HTML Control:

  • Two new pages in SAP GUI options dialog can be used to configure the control
  • Data downloaded via the HTML Control is stored in a SAP GUI specific folder and the lifetime of this data can be managed (automatic deletion)
  • Trusted file types can be automatically launched after having been downloaded via the HTML Control
  • When ABAP applications open external browser windows, SSO can be managed without using the browser extension that is still required in release 8.00
Further improvements

Some of the other interesting features:

  • Improved filtering of items in SAP Logon
  • Grouping of SAP GUI windows by SAP System ID and client in the Windows taskbar
  • Input history for F4 (searchhelp) control
  • Improved tabchain including group tab chain for F4 (searchhelp) control
  • Many keyboard improvements, especially support for reordering and resizing columns in table-like structures
  • Option to display an entered password in clear text if the user wants to see what he / she entered

What you can expect from the beta program

As soon as the program starts (this is expected in October 2025), you will get:

  • Access to the most current version of SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 for test purposes
  • A contact within the SAP GUI development team that you can use to provide feedback to us or ask questions you may have

How to join

If you are interested in participating in the beta program you can apply for registration by creating a support incident within the next couple of days. The incident must be created on component BC-FES-GUI with the title “8.10 beta program” and you should provide:

  • A contact person for the beta program with name, email address and S-User ID
  • An information about which of the areas mentioned above you are interested in

This data will exclusively be used for organizing the beta program.

Please note that the number of participants is limited and thus only customers who can and will actively participate in the program and are going to use one of the features above should register.

Once you are chosen, you will be asked to sign an online test and evaluation agreement before getting access to download the beta version of SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 in October. The program will last until end of November 2025, so you will be having a couple of weeks time to get a first impression and provide some feedback to us.

Beta program for SAP Business Client 8.10

Together with our SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 beta program, a beta program for SAP Business Client 8.10 is being conducted. You can find more information in this blog post:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/call-for-beta-testing-the-sap-business-client-8-10/ba-p/14171021

We are looking forward to working with you in our SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 Beta Program! And as always we are also looking forward to getting feedback which helps shaping our future direction.

Kind regards,
Frank Krause
Development Manager SAP GUI for Windows
SAP Development

entry.title: Re: How the capacity planning works in warehouse manageme...

entry.title: What is the order in which the status is sorted while using Status,LogEnd desc filter
entry.content:
I am retrieving the status of the MPL through the API. I want to check if a particluar iflow is completed.

We have been using the following query :

/api/v1/MessageProcessingLogs?$filter=IntegrationFlowName%20eq%20%27IFLOWNAME%27%20and%20LogStart%20gt%20datetime%272025-09-01T11:59:31.658%27&$top=1

This sometimes do not retrieve the 'Completed' status at all.

So I have added order by LogEnd desc. This was going smooth until at for an iflow the Completed timestamp is 5:44:07 and DISCARDED timestamp is 5:44:10, my code kept picking the DISCARDED status and there was no way it is going to retrieve the details of the COMPLETED logs.

On further analysis I found there is this filter option to orderBy: Status,LogEnd desc

I want to know how this filter works, which status gets the precedence in this filter. 

If I have Completed and Abandoned status , and Abandoned is the latest which one will be retrieved as Top 1 while using this?

Thanks,

entry.title: Re: Integrating SAP SuccessFactors with SAP Build Process Automation via SAP Cloud Application Event
entry.content:
Hi @acharyaw ,

At Step 3, when Creating a Formation, I get an error as "Synchronization between SAP SuccessFactors System <sf system> and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub System <event hub instance> has failed.

– SAP Cloud Application Event Hub System <event hub instance> returned a technical error for assignment with ID <some UID>:
"The system <sf system name> of type SAP SuccessFactors is unknown to SAP Cloud Application Event Hub. This is an indication that the step 'Creating the service instance' uses some parameters that don't match the system being synchronized. System details used for matching: namespace 'sap.sf', deployment region '', system id '<sf system id>'"".
 
The sf system is hosted in region DC33. Even if I try to resyncronize I get the same error.
 
Regards,
Melwyn
